intro: Ceropegia paohsingensis, commonly known as the Hainan ceropegia, is a flowering plant native to China's Hainan Island. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its trailing stems and tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or limestone habitats, showcasing its adaptability to specific ecological conditions. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
